title: "Tentative Elise changes" on PBE
body: I was really excited when I saw the one for Rappel, "Rappel (Spider E) New Effect - After descending, Elise's personal spider attacks have their bonuses increased by 40/55/70/85/100% for 5 seconds". Looks like an actual damage buff right? But lets take a look at the new numbers: "Spider Form (R) New Effect-  now heals Elise for half  (5/10/15/20 +.15 AP) of the bonus magic damage on hit." Compare this to the old on hit damage: ON-HIT MAGIC DAMAGE: 10 / 20 / 30 / 40 (+ 30% AP). That's right, at max rank in rappel, you're doing the same amount of damage for 5 seconds that you used to be doing for free. Gee, thanks for the "buffs" Riot, when you said changes you should have said "compensation".

replies.body: In this set of changes, which aren't necessarily final yet, the damage on auto attacks isn't changing. The 5/10/15/20 +.15 AP number you're looking at there is the heal per auto attack, not the new damage value (we're considering shifting the healing from the W to the R). The post Rappel bonus is then a multiplier to the 10-40 damage, boosting that to 20-80 and the heal (which is half the bonus damage) to 10-40.

Honestly, if you plan on improveing her AAs in spiderform, you need far more changes.
The main problem of elise isn't that she lacks sustain or dps in spiderform, but that she heavily lacks the potential to use it, as sticking in AA range is nearly impossible with her.
And besides that, i played her on PBE, and that offensive steroid on E feels horrible, it was never even remotly statisfying to use, the only times you could ever make use of that steroid is when you use your E in a suboptimal way, it simply clashes with the general idea and usecase off Rappel, which feels shitty for the elise player.

I feel like if they plan on going in this direction Elise needs to be tankier.

 It's all well and good having 1.3K DPS until you realise you're made out of glass and a melee who has to sacrifice your only form of defence to get that DPS.

Personally I found it fun, abet fairly weak. On the rare occasion you can use it offensively you're like hyper Azir. I found my self dealing 600 raw damage per hit 2 times a second while healing 200 HP per hit, as far as a split-push style goes it's fairly good. It's going to be trash in team fights though.

wel, tankiness alone won't help, she needs better ways to stay in AA range.
Both E and Q in spiderform only get her to max AA distance at their target, so best she can get is one AA after that if the target is running.
E and Q both should place her much closer to her target, and she needs either a slow on melee Q, or a fiora style speedbuff on W.
In addition, some defstats in spiderform would be great.
Since al this would overbuff her, she needs some nerfs elsewhere, which mostly should be targeted on her Q burst to finialize the transition from burst tank/assasin to dps-bruiser

A MS buff on W sounds like a really good idea, but I don't agree with nerfing her Q damage. Elise should still be playable as an assassin, even if it's not her main build. I'd say give her MS for MS. Lower her spider base MS by 10, make her W Elise's spells and autos grant 2/4/6/8/10 MS stacking up to 3 times.

This makes her stickier without making her 'quicker'.

Her spiderlings already don't hit optimally, even if you have the speed for them to keep up. Last thing they need is a further drop from viability (like this drop on spiderling heal). Why are they there, again?

What she needs is a realistic way for her spiderlings to damage.

I meant spider form, not spiderlings. I can see how that could be confusing.

Hell you could even allow the spider's MS to stack up as hers does.

yea, reminds me of how release-elise once had worked out, really miss her bruiser days. Unfortunatelly she had been neglected by the community that way and then went duelist/assassin till she got killed for being too effective at her job...maybe they should just take a look at her release identity and go from there.

You might be somewhat disappointed to hear this, but I think this is the most assassin-like Elise has ever been. She's not an assassin per-say, but rather somewhat of a Melee hyper carry (think Yi). 

She effectively has 50% lifesteal built in, a 140% AS steroid and a 2x auto damage steroid, she can't crit, but that's really her only downside to traditional M/ADC's, her base damage even gets insane late game. She also gets far better itemisation than any true M/ADC since she has access to items like Hourglass/Abyssal (don't build on the PBE, it doesn't work).

I don't think fighter's a fair title for her any more, nor is assassin, she's something entirely different right now.

In the long-term, I think Elise needs to work her way out from her spiderlings being targetable. Not only does it leave her in a wreck when AoE comps or Hydra champs face you, but it also leaves her unusually strong against certain compositions, particularly single-target CC skillshot comps. That "minion cloud" you have following can take a lot of hits for you, and I don't think that leaves her able to be healthy. They add a dynamic of gameplay that is overly exploitable, and shuts down a lot of particular team comps that are supposed to be able to pick off single trouble champions, such as Elise herself.

Then again, I say the same thing about Yasuo. Why is his Windwall healthy in the League of Skillshots again?
Have you considered allowing Elise benefit from her AS passive for her spider lings on skittering frenzy?
Why are you guys trying to make Elise (Spider) more AA focused?

The tooltip definitely needs to be reworded to be less confusing, as currently Rappel (Spider E) says:

* "_After descending, Elise's personal spider attacks have their **bonuses** increased by 40/55/70/85/100% for 5 seconds_"

While  her Spider Form (R) says:

* "_Elise deals (10/20/30/40 +.30 AP) bonus Magic Damage per attack **and** heals herself for half that amount._"

The way this is worded would mean at max Rappel rank, Elise would do twice as much magic damage, but *also* her healing would no longer be half of her magic damage, but instead 100% of it, as 50% doubled is 100%. That would mean Elise would heal by (20/40/60/80 +.60 AP) per attack if the tooltip were true.

It also is vague enough to make me ask "Does that apply to _any_ bonuses I have on my attacks while in Spider Form, like {{item:3115}}?"


Maybe Rappel's tooltip could be reworded to just say something like this:

* "_After descending, **Spider Form**'s bonus magic damage is increased by 40/55/70/85/100% for 5 seconds_" ?
